TopicTitle: Eve lander capable of return from sea level

Articles.Content:
I thought I could share this.

Craft File

VAB shot:

Showcase of a slightly older version (no descent crew cabins, weaker deorbit stage).

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Most impressive. Indeed you are powerful, as the Emperor has foreseen.

The configuration of engines and tanks looks similar to a design I've seen before, but obviously it carries even more fuel and has even more weight savings in its whole design. Very well done sir.
Now that's awesome. If Eve didn't hate me(and if I was better at rendezvous), I'd use the layout.
Tis not a ship, tis a great Deltav eating machine from the deep.
I'm starting to think I may have massively underbuilt the Eve rescue lander I just built and sent out...

Wow, this looks very much like the Eve lander I'm building for my Grand Tour. I might have to try that landing frame solution you have there, genius. I'm also using different engines on the outer ring and the core stage (LV45 center, "Cutter" Linear Aerospikes outer ring, more power for lower efficiency).

I'll have to post a pic and get some advice with mine.

Here is my lander flying to Eve

I use your design for parachutes and gears. That's very smart

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/68217-Mission-to-Eve?p=945029#post945029
Hey, sorry to bump an old thread, but do you still have a download for this? The Sendspace link has expired, unfortunately.
Same here, its a very good design, link is expired, i really want to try this, but building one from scratch will be too much of an unconvenience for this lazy guy
You can try the one in my signature if Kasuha doesn't supply his. Also this thread has a lot of good designs and ideas for Eve landers if you want inspiration.
